intro: Paepalanthus piresii, commonly known as the Piresii arrowroot, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that collect water, forming a central pool. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. It is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
